title: Polio: Virus found in London prompts misleading vaccine claims
description: What do these cases really tell us about the virus, which hasn't spread in the UK for decades?

title: Ukraine war: Ros Atkins on… why Kaliningrad is important
description: The BBC’s Analysis Editor Ros Atkins examines why Russia is making threats after the EU sanctioned a Russian region cut off from the rest of the country.

title: Giant ceramic sculpture by Sandy Brown has been unveiled in Cornwall
description: The UK's largest ceramic sculpture has been unveiled in Cornwall - but not everyone is convinced.

title: Week in pictures: 18-24 June 2022
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken in the past seven days.

title: Agnipath: Where Indian army job dreams are made and broken
description: Inside coaching centres where desperate young people study to get a job in the armed forces.

title: Mauritius medical clown: 'When I see the kids smiling I feel really good'
description: Sharon Juhl is not your ordinary clown, he is a medical clown bringing smiles to hospitalised children.

title: Kidnap alert heightens Iran-Israel shadow war fears
description: The warnings for Israeli tourists join assassinations and sabotage as the foes aim at each other.

title: Kenyan elections: The woman who rallies crowds - but won't vote
description: Diana Mwazi is one of many young Kenyans who see elections as a way to make money, not bring change.

title: Ukraine war: Families risking all to escape through Russia to Georgia
description: Risky escape routes have opened up for Ukrainians - including driving through Russia to Georgia.

title: Roe v Wade: Elation and despair outside US Supreme Court
description: Women across the US have sharply different reactions to the decision to overturn Roe v Wade.

title: LGBT awards: Adele Roberts named role model of the year
description: The Radio 1 presenter receives "role model" award for opening up the conversation around bowel cancer.

title: Afghanistan earthquake: Survivors count horrific cost
description: Near the epicentre of the quake that struck Afghanistan this week, houses lie in ruins.

title: Pompeii: Ancient pregnant tortoise surprises archaeologists
description: The reptile's 2,000-year-old remains are discovered by archaeologists buried in volcanic ash and rock.

title: Supreme Court ruling hailed by top Missouri official who has 'effectively ended abortion'
description: State Attorney General Eric Schmitt says Missouri has effectively ended abortion.

title: Ukraine war: Kyiv orders forces to withdraw from Severodonetsk
description: Severodonetsk is the current focus of Russia as it tries to take control of eastern Ukraine.

title: Supreme Court abortion decision must not be the final word - Biden
description: Overturning Roe v Wade shows the Supreme Court is out of touch with most Americans, Biden says.

title: England v New Zealand: Jonny Bairstow hits remarkable century
description: Watch as Jonny Bairstow hits his second century of the series to help England recover from 55-6 on the second day of the third Test at Headingley.

title: Abortion: What does overturn of Roe v Wade mean?
description: Abortion restrictions will vary by state now the 50-year-old landmark ruling has been reversed.

title: Roe v Wade: Why this is a seismic day in America
description: The divide in America has become even deeper after this Supreme Court ruling, writes Sarah Smith.

title: Roe v Wade: The moment the constitutional right to abortion was struck down
description: Anti-abortion protesters cheer after finding out the Supreme Court has struck down abortion rights.

title: Roe v Wade: What is US Supreme Court ruling on abortion?
description: The US Supreme Court has overturned the landmark case which legalised abortion in 1973.

title: Wilfred Owen and Philip Larkin GCSE removal 'cultural vandalism'
description: The poets are not part of a new GCSE poetry anthology drawn up by an exam board.

title: Moments that made this by-election historic
description: The Tories and PM Boris Johnson are dealt a major blow as the Lib Dems and Labour win two seats.

title: Wimbledon: Emma Raducanu, Andy Murray and Serena Williams learn first-round opponents
description: British number one Emma Raducanu is drawn against Belgium's Alison van Uytvanck in the Wimbledon first round.

title: Rikki Neave murder: James Watson jailed for 15 years
description: James Watson, who was 13 at the time of the killing, evaded justice for nearly three decades.

title: UK sees another jump in Covid infections
description: The rise, with an estimated one in 35 people testing positive, is being driven by newer variants.

title: Prince Charles tells Commonwealth of sorrow over slavery
description: The prince also tells Commonwealth leaders that it is up to nations whether they choose to remain monarchies.

title: Tory chairman quits after by-election losses
description: Oliver Dowden resigns, but the PM vows to go on after the Lib Dems and Labour inflict defeats on the Conservatives.

title: Risk of further BA strikes as more staff consulted
description: The airline's engineers and call centre workers in the UK are being consulted over industrial action.

title: Labour regain Wakefield lost in last election
description: The Labour leader says voters in the city's by-election saw a party "united and focused".

title: England v New Zealand: Tom Blundell unable to review lbw decision
description: New Zealand's Tom Blundell is unhappy as he is given out lbw, but with DRS unavailable is unable to review the decision on day two of the third Test at Headingley.

title: LIV Golf series: DP World Tour fines and bans players who took part at Centurion
description: The DP World Tour issues a £100,000 fine to players who competed in June's LIV Golf event and bans them from the Scottish Open.

title: Katie Price avoids jail for restraint order breach
description: The ex-model is sentenced for breaching a restraining order against her ex-husband's fiancée.

title: Japanese man loses USB stick with entire city's personal details
description: A Japanese worker lost a USB stick containing the data of 460,000 people during a night out.

title: Birmingham Airport chief executive gets 49% pay rise
description: Nick Barton is paid £595,000 as boss of Birmingham Airport where passengers have found major delays.

title: Wet wipe pollution: 'Fine to flush' message still not understood
description: New photos from Hull show how much of a problem the beauty products are still causing in sewers.

description: The planets appear in the sky 'like a string of pearls' until Monday.

description: Boris Johnson once again faces questions about his leadership following two defeats and a resignation.

title: US Senate passes first gun control bill in decades
description: The landmark bill is a rare moment of cooperation between the two parties over gun control measures.

title: Lib Dems wipe out Tory majority in by-election

title: Sha'Carri Richardson fails to advance in 100m at US trials for World Championships

description: Newly-elected Richard Foord says his win is a loud and clear message to the PM.

description: Labour's Simon Lightwood criticises Boris Johnson in his victory speech after regaining the Wakefield seat.

title: Wimbledon: Emma Raducanu 'not being distracted by commercial interests', says agent

title: Nettle eaters set for prickly Dorset contest as events returns

description: The papers lead with airport staff voting to strike and the PM meeting Prince Charles in Rwanda.

title: Glastonbury 2022: Billie Eilish to make history as youngest-ever headliner
description: The pop star will be the festival's youngest-ever solo headliner when she tops the bill on Friday.

description: The once near-extinct birds of prey are being flown abroad to help rescue dwindling Spanish populations.
